title: Mechanical Engineer - Optical and Precision Systems
description:
Company Description  
  
Are you passionate about engineering? Do you want to make a difference? 

You could be one of our 54k\\+ colleagues in over 30 countries working on inspiring projects in the most innovative companies. 

Join us and start building tomorrow’s world today!

Job Description  
  
**About the Role:**

Are you a **Mechanical Engineer** with expertise in **optical and precision engineering**? We’re seeking a skilled individual to join our team in a **remote role**, working on **high\\-precision mechanical\\-optical systems**. You’ll be involved in the **design, integration, and evaluation of small structures**, collaborating with a dynamic team of engineers on **cutting\\-edge projects**.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design and develop **small structures** with **precision integration**.
* Perform **thickness evaluation of plates** and work on tightly integrated **mechanical\\-optical systems.**
* Collaborate remotely with engineers to deliver **high\\-precision designs.**
* Contribute to **mechanical design** and **optical\\-mechanical integration.**
* Work on **complex, high\\-accuracy engineering projects.**

Qualifications  
  
**Skills \\& Experience Required:**

* **Mechanical engineering background** with experience in **optical and precision engineering.**
* Expertise in **small structures, precision integration**, and **thickness evaluation.**
* Exposure to **mechanical design** and **optical\\-mechanical integration**
* **Intermediate\\-level experience** with recent, relevant project work.
* Strong **collaboration skills** and ability to work effectively in a **remote team environment**.

  
  
Additional Information  
  
**Why join us?** 

We foster a community of dually talented individuals who are both entrepreneurs and technology specialists. Our teams embody the spirit of innovation and entrepreneurship, enabling us to develop solutions most efficiently. 

Our commitment to sustainable growth is unwavering, and we continuously strive for accelerated transformation and continuous improvement. Through ALTEN labs, mentoring programs, internal universities, and more, we are always pushing boundaries and embracing new possibilities. 

We offer incredible opportunities to join inspiring projects in the most innovative companies. 

We prioritise your career development with personalised support plans tailored to your own aspirations. We're here to empower you and help you reach your full potential. 

Join our passionate team and start building tomorrow, today! 

**In short you get:** 

* A personalised career path and a rewarding management style
* A chance to work on the most exciting engineering projects and technologies along with Premium Customers
* A huge diversity of engineering projects and industries
* A competitive salary
* Private Medical Insurance
* Pension Scheme
* Cycle\\-to\\-work Scheme among many additional benefits
* Social atmosphere, regular gatherings, and team buildings
* Flexible way of working (role dependent)

title: Cash Operations Reconciliation Specialist
description:
**Why Revere Medical:**  
Revere Medical gives new life to clinics in need of tools resources, and support so they can start delivering the personalized care their communities deserve. We’re committed in supporting our employees by offering competitive benefits that contribute to your overall well\\-being. 

**Cash Operations Reconciliation:**This position is responsible for Revere Medical follow\\-up operations, meeting goals and company objectives, in assigned areas of cash posting, collections, payment validation, customer service and correspondence using any patient accounting system. Reconciliation Specialist must ensure that all processes meet all government mandated procedures for integrity and compliance. 

**Is this you:**  
Are you committed to improving patient outcomes? Do you enjoy collaborating with a team to ensure quality patient care?   
Do you want to improve the overall health of the community? 

**What you will do:** 

* Produce month end finance reports.
* Handle non patient cash.
* Manage Intercompany Transfers.
* Reconcile patient account postings to deposits in bank.
* Transfer payments to and from the various Revere Medical vendors.
* Work manager holds in Athena related to claims.
* Maintains strict confidentiality and adheres to all HIPAA guidelines/regulations.

**Requirements**:

* 2\\+ years’ experience with medical billing/collection; physician billing experience preferred.
* 2\\+ years’ experience with Cash Operations including balancing, reconciliation, and EOB interpretation.
* Knowledge of basic medical coding/terminology and third\\-party insurance operating procedures and practices a plus.
* Knowledge of revenue cycle and/or business office procedures.
* Experience with Athena Health or similar software is a plus.
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships and communicate clearly with customers and insurance companies both within and outside of Revere Medical.

**Education**: 

* Associates degree or a combination of High School and relative work experience

**About Revere Medical:**  
At Revere Medical we promise to provide care you can trust, outcomes you deserve, and a future you can count on. We are guided by our steadfast commitment to improving patient outcomes by empowering providers to deliver exceptional care needed to forge stronger, healthier communities. We are the leader in delivering patient\\-centered, provider led services that improve patient outcomes and strengthen communities. 

**Benefits Offered**:   
Medical coverage (with discounts for using services through Revere), Dental, Vision, HSA with company contribution, Retirement plans, Life and Disability Insurance and much more! 

*Revere Medical does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, military service obligations, citizenship, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state, or federal law.*

title: Apartment Leasing Professional
description:
**Leasing Professional \\- Rockledge Flats \\| Rockledge, FL**

**Who We Are:** Founded in 1975, **CONAM Management** operates in 10 states, across 26 key metropolitan markets, supporting over 60,000 apartment units of both affordable and conventional housing. Our growing team of over 1,700 associates is dedicated to maintaining and enhancing the quality of life for our residents. At **CONAM**, we foster a collaborative, team\\-oriented culture where our associates thrive and are valued for their expertise and commitment.

**What We Are Looking For:**

We are seeking an enthusiastic **Leasing Professional** to join our team at **Rockledge Flats** in **Rockledge, FL**. In this role, you will be instrumental in achieving our apartment community’s leasing goals, maximizing occupancy rates, and enhancing resident satisfaction and retention. You will be responsible for the day\\-to\\-day operations related to leasing apartments, conducting property tours, processing applications, and executing renewal strategies to maintain high levels of resident engagement.

This is a full\\-time position with full benefits. Pay range: $22\\.00 \\- $25\\.00 per hour

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Leasing \\& Marketing:** Promote the apartment community, conduct tours, and implement outreach campaigns to drive traffic. Manage online listings and social media to increase visibility.
* **Lease Signing \\& Move\\-In Coordination:** Facilitate applicant screenings, prepare leases, and ensure smooth move\\-ins. Maintain accurate lease documentation.
* **Resident Satisfaction \\& Retention:** Build relationships to encourage renewals, address concerns, and implement retention strategies.
* **Sales \\& Lead Generation:** Convert leads into leases, meet leasing goals, and generate new prospects through events and follow\\-ups.
* **Administrative Support:** Maintain accurate records, assist in reporting, and support the Community Manager with lease renewals, resident files, and compliance with regulations.

**Who You Are:** (Requirements of the Position)

* You have at least 1\\-2 years of customer service experience, ideally in a sales environment or leasing property management role.
* You have a passion for helping people find their ideal apartment home.
* Goal Oriented.
* You thrive in a fast\\-paced environment and can handle multiple responsibilities, including leasing apartments, conducting tours, managing paperwork, and addressing resident needs.
* You are proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook), and comfortable learning or knowing property management software like Yardi, MRI, or other leasing and property management systems.
* You possess a friendly, energetic, and approachable personality that resonates with both prospective and current residents.
* You are available to work weekends, which is essential for meeting the needs of potential residents and conducting tours during high\\-traffic hours.
* You are physically able to lift and carry items weighing up to 25 pounds.

**Why You'll Love Working Here:**  
CONAM Management Corporation is more than just a job — it’s a career where you can grow and be recognized for your expertise in Property Management. We offer a competitive pay, comprehensive **benefits package**, that make working at CONAM even more rewarding.

**Our benefits include:**

* Medical, dental, vision insurance
* Pet insurance
* Life insurance and identity theft protection
* Paid sick and vacation time
* 401(k) plan with company match
* Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Additional perks: Service award days, floating holiday, early earned wage access and more

At **CONAM**, we pride ourselves on our culture of excellence and commitment to fostering an inclusive, diverse, and supportive work environment.

**Additional Information:**

* This position is contingent upon passing a background check, employment verification, and drug screening.
* CONAM will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirement of the law.
* We are an **Equal Opportunity Employer** and encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

**Ready to make an impact?**  
If you're excited about joining a team that values your skills and offers great benefits, **click “APPLY”**.

**Pay Bands**: Pay bands are established based on geographic location, internal equity, market conditions, and candidate qualifications. We provide competitive compensation based on experience and qualifications.

title: Senior MLOps Engineer
description:
**Company Overview**

Promise empowers utilities and government agencies to create flexible, affordable solutions for individuals struggling with debt. Our innovative approach to payment plans and relief distribution significantly improves enrollment and recovery rates, helping individuals clear debts faster and reducing delinquencies for our partners.

We treat people facing financial difficulties with respect and dignity, providing the tools and resources they need to thrive. Our team includes experts from companies like Palantir, Google, Stripe , and esteemed government leaders.

Backed by over $50 million in funding from top investors such as 8VC, Kapor Capital, XYZ Ventures, and Howard Schultz, we've been recognized as one of Fast Company's "World's Most Innovative Companies of 2022\\."

Role Overview As an MLOps Engineer at Promise, you'll be at the forefront of integrating artificial intelligence and machine learning into our mission of transforming the way individuals facing financial difficulty receive and interact with essential public services. Your primary responsibility will be to design, develop, test, and manage end\\-to\\-end generative AI and large language model (LLM) applications and services for both internal and external products. This will include creating and managing complex AI systems, integrating LLMs, real\\-time systems, APIs, and agentic workflows in a robust, scalable, and powerful manner. Your expertise in AI technologies will drive innovation, efficiency, and automation across our platform.

Join us in a dynamic, growth\\-oriented environment where your work will directly impact people's lives and shape the future of government services. This is an exceptional opportunity to be a key player in leveraging AI to enhance our product offerings and drive positive social impact.

**What Will Enable You*** 
A minimum of 7 years of professional software development experience.

* 
Passionate drive for our mission and relentless pursuit of customer success.

* 
Intolerance for mediocrity and high commitment to doing everything necessary to achieve your goals.

* 
High moral and ethical standards, seeking open and honest communication, and rejecting manipulation, dishonesty, and intolerance.

* 
Demonstrated dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees, and local communities.

* 
Experience with Python, especially for asynchronous applications.

* 
Expertise with LLMOps, general MLOps, or other closely related AI specializations, especially experience with testing and maintaining production LLM applications and with self\\-hosting ML models.

* 
Experience with cloud infrastructure (Terraform, Pulumi).

* 
Experience with scalable, containerized solutions (Kubernetes, GKE, ECS, Docker).

* 
Strong proficiency in systems architecture.


Promise is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant or employee because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, genetic information, age, or military or veteran status. Additionally, the Company complies with applicable state and local laws governing non\\-discrimination in employment in every jurisdiction in which it operates. Promise is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We also provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, pregnant individuals, and those with sincerely held religious beliefs, in accordance with applicable laws.

Promise engages in US government contracts and restricts hiring to US persons, which includes US citizens and permanent residents (e.g., Green Card holders). Additionally, candidates must reside in the US.

Compensation Range: $150K \\- $215K

title: Territory Sales Manager
description:
**TERRITORY SALES MANAGER – LANCASTER, CALIFORNIA**

**WEBCO HR, Inc.** is seeking a Territory Sales Manager for one of our clients located in Lancaster, California.

 

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

 

**Sales Growth:**

 

· Develop and execute a strategic sales plan to achieve and exceed sales targets for Containers, Ground Level Offices, Singlewide Modular Structures, Complex Modular Structures (in certain markets) and value\\-added products.

· Approximately 40% of time will be spent on outbound prospecting, 30% on inbound inquiry conversion, and the balance on account development and in\\-person prospecting or customer visits.

· Identify and prioritize potential customers, industries, and market segments to pursue for business development.

· Maintain a robust sales pipeline and consistently work towards converting leads into successful sales.

· Pursue a high volume of top project and transactional opportunities while offering turnkey space solutions and value\\-added products.

 

**Customer Relationship Management:**

 

· Build and maintain strong, long\\-lasting customer relationships through regular communication, site visits, and exceptional customer service.

· Understand customer needs, provide product recommendations, and address inquiries or concerns promptly.

· Collaborate with customers to create tailored solutions that meet their specific container and modular structure requirements.

· Utilize Salesforce CRM system to track performance and manage customers collaboratively.

 

**Market Analysis:**

 

· Stay up to date with industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities within the territory.

· Conduct market research and analysis to identify potential opportunities for growth and differentiation.

· Provide feedback to the management team on market insights and customer feedback.

 

**Quoting and Pricing:**

 

· Employ a consultative selling approach where appropriate to maximize pricing and monthly lease rates.

· Prepare accurate and competitive price quotes for potential customers.

· Negotiate terms and conditions of sales agreements to ensure mutually beneficial outcomes.

· Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless order processing and delivery.

 

**Reporting and Documentation:**

 

· Maintain detailed records of sales activities, customer interactions, and sales forecasts using CRM software.

· Generate regular reports on sales performance, market trends, and competitor activity for management review.

· Meet daily/weekly expectations on leading indicators to meet trifecta goals.

**Team Collaboration:**

 

· Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams, including operations, logistics, and customer support, to ensure customer satisfaction and successful project execution.

**REQUIREMENTS**

 

· High school diploma, GED or applicable experience.

· 1 year of outbound prospecting experience, or 1 year of experience at WSMM.

· Willingness and ability to travel 10%\\-20% to conduct field visits with important customers

· Demonstrated professional communication skills.

· Experience effectively using Microsoft Office (including Outlook, Word, and Excel) and Teams).

**COMPENSATION:**

 

· $68,640 Annual Base Salary.

· Commission.

· Full Benefits.

**THE COMPANY:**

Our client has the largest fleet of quality modular building and portable storage units in North America including Clearspan structures, climate\\-controlled options and so much more. They focus on doing one thing very well: making it easy for the customer to get the sto0rage containers and modular buildings they need, configured as they need them and delivered where and when they need them.

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer (Remote)
description:
**Los Angeles (Santa Monica) or Remote (North America timezones)**

**Maximus** (https://www.maximustribe.com/) is a mission\\-driven consumer health company that provides men with content, community, and clinical support to optimize them in mind and body. Maximus has raised $15M from top Silicon Valley VCs such as Founders Fund and 8VC as well as leading angel investors/operators from companies like Bulletproof, Tinder, Coinbase, Daily Stoic, \\& Shopify.

**Maximus** is building an advanced telemedicine platform to help men improve their mental and physical health. We iterate on our product rapidly and safely by applying continuous integration and code quality measurements, as well as TDD and pair programming when appropriate. We work collaboratively, emphasizing the productivity of the team first. We aim to deliver a robust, reliable system by using pragmatic, tried\\-and\\-true technologies. We hone our craft as engineers by applying advanced functional, data\\-oriented techniques that are appropriate to the problem.

**Please note:** Culture is key at Maximus, so we get to know candidates holistically through our questionnaire. You will receive an invite in a separate email upon submitting an application. Please fill it out as honestly and intuitively as possible since it is designed to detect exaggeration, which will cause your application to be automatically rejected. The questionnaire is optional to submit now with your application, but candidates that do so will get strongly prioritized. Note, we do not have access to individual questions’ answers/choices. 

**Responsibilities:**

* 
**Write and ship high quality code.** Contribute across the codebase to complete entire features and changes with support from the rest of the team. Continuously invest in demonstrable quality and reliability of the system via unit tests, automated integration tests, TDD and refactoring. Keep data management and security in mind at all times to protect customer privacy.

* 
**Contribute to a continuously improving engineering organization.** Identify software quality, performance, and operational issues, including impediments to team\\-wide efficiency and work constructively with the team to address them. Define and improve our internal engineering standards and processes and exert positive influence on the objectives and tactics taken by the team.

* 
**Contribute actively to product iteration and development to ensure the company delivers a compelling experience to its customers.** Generate ideas and assess the associated options and tradeoffs for how they impact the growth of the business and customer experience. Work across functional teams (engineering, marketing, product, etc.) to translate business and product ideas into software designs and releases. Product \\& Project Management skills and experience are a plus.


**The ideal candidate will have the following:**

**Experience:**

* 
6\\+ years of experience in product software development, especially public consumer web applications

* 
**Front\\-end:** *React/Redux/ImmutableJS* experience

* 
**Back\\-end:** *Ruby*\\-on\\-*Rails* / *Ruby* experience

+ 
Ruby experience is highly preferred


* 
General experience in unit testing, integration testing.

* 
Past experience or interest in pair programming.


**Nice to Have:**

* 
Familiarity with queue / background processing, 3rd party integrations (such as Stripe, or 3PL, etc.)

* 
Familiarity with or interest in Event Sourcing and other immutability / functional\\-programming patterns.

* 
TDD experience is a plus.


**Qualities:**

* 
A dedication to keeping things **simple** and **pragmatic**.

* 
Attitude of **shared ownership** of the system, frequent integration. Collaborates proactively, in service of the shared highest priority.

* 
**Strong communication and teamwork skills:** Proven ability to build strong relationships with technical and non\\-technical members of the team to solve challenging technical and business problems.

* 
**Relentlessly Resourceful (****http://www.paulgraham.com/relres.html****):** highly proactive, does not quit, and finds innovative solutions with little guidance. Bias for action and ability to thrive in an ambiguous environment with a high degree of autonomy.

* 
**Passion for Men’s Health \\& Development**: interest in helping men develop a healthy masculinity. Demonstrates personal dedication and interest in health *optimization* (e.g. diet, exercise, sleep, focus, and relationships).


**World\\-Class Benefits:**

* 
Premium Blue Shield Platinum PPO \\& HMO Plans (up to 80% coverage)

* 
Full Suite: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance

* 
Best\\-in\\-class 401K options

* 
Flexible vacation/time\\-off policies

* 
Liquidity of options whenever available

* 
Extended options exercise window for loyal employees (3 months for every year of service; e.g. 1 year for 4\\+ year employees)


*Maximus is an equal opportunity employer, which not only includes standard protected categories, but the additional freedom from discrimination against your free speech and beliefs, as long as they are aligned with company values. We celebrate intellectual diversity.*

Compensation Range: $130K \\- $160K

title: Sr. People Operations & HRIS Specialist
description:
**About SiTime**

SiTime Corporation is the precision timing company. Our semiconductor MEMS programmable solutions offer a rich feature set that enables customers to differentiate their products with higher performance, smaller size, lower power and better reliability. With more than 3 billion devices shipped, SiTime is changing the timing industry. For more information, visit www.sitime.com.

 

**Job Summary**

As a Sr. People Operations \\& HRIS Specialist, you’ll play a pivotal role in managing, optimizing, and analyzing our Human Resource Information Systems (HRIS) to ensure effective HR Operations. You will lead HRIS projects, working closely with HR professional to enhance system capabilities, streamline processes, and provide data\\-driven insights to support organizational goals. Our Human Resources team is dedicated to ensuring effective HR operations and your contributions will be instrumental in achieving this goal. 

**Responsibilities:**

 

* HRIS Management: Maintain the HRIS (ADP WFN) and related systems, ensuring data integrity, security, and compliance with relevant regulations.
* System Optimization: Identify and implement enhancements and upgrades to the HRIS to improve user experience and operational efficiency.
* Data Entry: Support heavy data entry for the employee life cycle, optimize and automate entries where applicable, upload mass changes, and support system updates.
* Data Analysis: Analyze HR data and metrics to provide insights and recommendations that support workforce planning, talent management, and other HR initiatives.
* Project Management: Lead and participate in HRIS\\-related projects, including system implementations, migrations, and integrations with other HR and business systems.
* User Support: Serve as a point of contact for HRIS users, providing training, troubleshooting, and ongoing support to ensure effective system utilization.
* Reporting: Develop and generate customized reports and dashboards for HR and management, ensuring timely delivery of critical data.
* Compliance: Support annual compliance reporting and surveys. Manage quarterly compliance training. Perform internal and external audits of HR processes and documents, including hiring, terminations, compensation, payroll, and compliance training, when applicable.
* Collaboration: Work collaboratively with cross\\-functional teams to align HRIS capabilities with business needs and strategic objectives.
* Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of HRIS processes, procedures, and changes for compliance and training purposes.

**Qualifications \\& Requirements:**

* 10\\-15 years of experience as HRIS Specialist or Analyst with multiple HRIS including ADP WFN.
* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Computer Science, Business, Mathematics or related degree preferred.
* Must have implementation experience and expertise in report generation and customization.
* Extensive experience in analyzing HRIS and HR data and metrics, strong excel skills preferred.
* Excellent attention to detail, critical thinking, and ability to problem solve.
* Advanced proficiency in database management and security.
* Ability to collaborate, provide technical support, and train staff.
* Ability to keep up with technical innovation and trends in HRIS Analysis.
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.
* Experience in documenting processes, as well as performing diagnostic tests and audits.

**Compensation Range:** The expected wage range for a new hire into this position is $133,300\\.00 \\- $183,000\\.00

The actual wage offered may vary depending on work location, experience, education, training, external market data, internal pay equity, or other bona fide factors.

 

SiTime compensation packages includes base salary, bonus based on achieving your innovation goals and equity. 

**Benefits offered:** 401k plan, health and wellness that includes medical, dental, vision, life, parental leave, legal services, and time off plans.

 

SiTime is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We treat each person fairly and we do not tolerate discrimination or harassment against anyone on the basis of any protected characteristics, including race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, pregnancy, political affiliation, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, or marital status or other characteristics protected by law. SiTime participates in the E\\-Verify program.

title: Electronic Parts Engineer
description:
Science Systems and Applications, Inc. (SSAI) is seeking Electronic Parts Engineer candidates for a potential opportunity to support NASA at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL), a federally funded research and development center located in California. Work may be performed at JPL or customer locations, or remotely, depending on contractual and operational requirements.

This role will perform selection, procurement, manufacture, use and/or testing/screening of electronic parts in high reliability applications. Apply knowledge of industry and/or academic practices and standards across a range of applications and systems. Provide technical support to flight electronic parts tasks including the creation of engineering requirements specifications and drawings, and advising projects on part selections maximizing reliability while considering cost and schedule constraints. Applies understanding of part and project risk knowledge to define part reliability and quality requirements and assess risks associated with waivers, deficiencies, and failures.

**Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor of Science degree with equivalent course work in Electrical Engineering, Physics, Materials Science/Engineering, Applied Mathematics or related technical discipline and at least 2 years of experience in parts engineering activities.
* Experience must include one or more related fields within the following areas: parts development, fabrication, manufacturing, process integration, reliability assessment, and test and/or qualification.
* Requires understanding and wide application of advanced principles, theories, concepts and techniques in electronic parts technologies resulting in contributions to the development of new test and qualification methodologies.

description:

title: Avionics Technician - Flight Simulator Tech
description:
**Flight Simulator Technician – Dallas, TX**

Seeking a motivated and detail\\-oriented **Flight Simulator Technician** to join our dynamic team in **Dallas, Texas**. This is a great opportunity to grow with a global leader in aviation training. As a Sim Tech, you’ll play a key role in ensuring our flight training devices are maintained to the highest standards and ready to support our customers' critical training needs.

**What You'll Do:**  
As a Sim Tech, you’ll be responsible for monitoring, troubleshooting, and maintaining a wide range of simulator systems—including computers, visuals, and peripheral components. Your goal: ensure all Flight Training Devices (FTDs) are mission\\-ready. You’ll receive full training on the specific equipment and systems used at the Dallas facility.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Perform routine and complex preventative/corrective maintenance tasks with minimal supervision.
* Diagnose and repair simulator sub\\-systems including electrical, visual, motion, and computing hardware.
* Power\\-up/power\\-down simulators and complete pre\\- and post\\-flight checks.
* Run and evaluate Qualification Test Guide (QTG) tests and visual alignment procedures.
* Use schematics, technical manuals, and diagnostic tools to isolate and resolve system issues.
* Maintain accurate records of maintenance actions using our Quality Management System.
* Support simulator sessions and interact professionally with customers to resolve issues promptly.
* Conduct basic computer/network maintenance and assist with software/hardware updates.
* Collaborate on inventory control, refurbishment projects, and equipment upgrades.
* Mentor junior technicians and support ongoing training initiatives.

**What We're Looking For:**

* Associate degree in electronics, avionics, or a related technical field; or 1–2 years of hands\\-on simulator maintenance experience.
* 2–3 years of relevant work experience, preferably in avionics, electronics, or computer technology.
* Solid understanding of analog/digital electronics and troubleshooting techniques.
* Experience reading schematics and using electronic diagnostic tools.
* Basic proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and familiarity with different computer operating systems.
* Soldering and circuit repair skills are a plus.
* Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends and shifts in a 24/7 operational environment.
* Overtime hours are available.
* Physically able to bend, climb stairs, and stand for extended periods.

**Why Join:** you’ll be part of a fast\\-growing, innovative company that’s redefining pilot training around the world. We offer a supportive environment, opportunities for advancement, and the chance to work with state\\-of\\-the\\-art technology in the aviation industry. Industry leading medical benefits for employee and family.

title: CNC Programmer 1st Shift (Local)
description:
Position SummaryUnder the general supervision of the Manufacturing Supervisor the CNC Programmer programs computer numerical controlled (CNC) machinery using Mastercam for both mill and lathes. Coordinates with the shop floor to ensure program performance and quality. Make general decisions as to quality, tolerances and operation sequence. Essential Job Duties* Read and interpret engineering drawings, blueprints, charts and tables or study sample parts to determine machining operation to be performed, and plan the best process for machining
* Compute dimensions and tolerances from conventional blueprints and CAD drawings using Mastercam and be able to design in Mastercam and be proficient in Four Axis programming
* Write programs for a variety of machine tools including computer numerically controlled (CNC) machines to produce precision parts
* Ensure dimensions of products for accuracy and conformance to specifications by verifying with the machine operator
* Provide set\\-up drawings and tool lists for machine tool operators
* Solid Works or Solid Edge is a plus and/or willingness to learn Solid Edge

Other Duties* Coordinate with Engineering and shop floor to create optimum machine utilization
* Report deviations from specifications and tolerances to supervisor
* Maintain detailed records of all programs along with complete documentation
* Perform other related duties as assigned

Qualifications* High school diploma or equivalent required
* Five years machine shop experience that includes machine programming.
* Must know CAD systems, Solid Edge and MasterCam, Able to write programs for various CNC equipment
* Able to read and interpret Engineering Drawings and Blue Prints
* A combination of four years of work experience in the trade and some college or industry courses in machining is usually required to be eligible for trade certification
* Trade certification for CNC programming in Mastercam is desirable
* Proficient in Mastercam programming
* Proficient in Four Axis programming
* Possess effective organization and time management skills, be detail oriented, use good judgment, and manage competing priorities for multiple projects and consistently meet all deadlines

Personal Qualities* Perform work independently and as part of a team
* Must be organized, reliable, punctual, adaptable and flexible
* Demonstrate a positive professional demeanor and dress
* Adhere to all company policies

Physical Demands and Work EnvironmentThe physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
Description:Find your place at The Partners Group, a purpose\\-driven company committed to making a difference in our community through our work and inspiring others to do the same.

  


TPG’s success is driven by a culture that values **partner**ships. We’re looking for people who invest in their relationships, seek to learn, create winning solutions for all, and do what they say they are going to do. Hard work goes without saying at TPG, supported by our culture that thrives on having fun while living well. This is what it means to be a partner for our clients and teammates. 

  


Are you ready to join an amazing organization that has won too many “Employer of Choice” awards to list? Let’s work together!

  


*The Partners Group currently has a unique opportunity for an innovative Salesforce professional to join our Operations team in Portland, OR as a Salesforce Administrator.*

  


**Please note: We are not accepting applications or inquiries from external recruiters or staffing agencies. Direct applicants only.**

  


**How you will make an impact at TPG**

We are seeking a Salesforce Administrator to join our IT team and take ownership of managing, optimizing, and enhancing our Salesforce platform. This role is crucial in ensuring system stability, improving workflows, and enabling business efficiency. You will collaborate with internal stakeholders to configure, maintain, and enhance Salesforce capabilities while troubleshooting issues and implementing scalable solutions.

Beyond day\\-to\\-day administration, you'll play a key role in strategic system improvements, automation, and user adoption, helping drive operational success across the organization.

  


**A typical day in this role**

* Manage Salesforce administration, including user setup, security settings, reports, dashboards, workflows, and system configurations.
* Provide technical support and troubleshooting, managing support tickets and ensuring data integrity.
* Automate processes using Salesforce Flow, optimizing workflows and system efficiency.
* Maintain sandbox environments and deploy changes using Gearset or Change Sets, following best practices.
* Monitor system performance, manage data backups, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Collaborate with business users and the IT team to implement enhancements and maximize platform functionality.
* Review Salesforce releases, assess impacts on the organization, and ensure smooth updates and improvements.
* Maintain system documentation and provide user training to optimize adoption and efficiency.

**Key details**

Location: Portland, OR (preferred), in\\-office with hybrid remote opportunities

Hours: 40 hours/week, Mon\\-Fri

Salary Range: $70,000\\-80,000 annually (depending on experience)

Physical Requirements: Ability to sit for long periods of time, ability to communicate verbally and in writing, and ability to handle long periods of screen time.

Travel: Minimal overnight travel (3–4 times per year) for office visits, training, or conferences. Employees within 50 miles of a TPG office may be expected to work onsite 2–3 days per week.

Requirements:**What you’ll bring to the table (required qualifications)**

* Salesforce Administrator Certification with 3\\+ years of hands\\-on experience in a corporate environment.
* Strong knowledge of Sales Cloud and Financial Services Cloud (or Service Cloud as a substitute).
* At least one year of hands\\-on experience with Salesforce Flow for process automation.
* A solid understanding of Salesforce best practices, system architecture, and governance.
* Experience managing user roles, permissions, and system security settings.
* Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non\\-technical stakeholders.
* Experience working in a collaborative technical team and managing multiple priorities in a matrixed structure.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).

**What will make you really stand out (preferred qualifications)**

* Experience working with Apex code (even basic familiarity is a plus).
* Ability to create and manage custom objects in Salesforce.
* Familiarity with Gearset for change management and deployment.
* Experience supporting a for\\-profit business with at least 75 Salesforce users.
* Strong problem\\-solving skills and a proactive mindset to identify and implement system improvements.

**What TPG can offer you**

* A rich benefits package including generous paid time off, medical and dental insurance, life and disability insurance, retirement plan, and employee stock purchase program
* Support and development to cultivate your knowledge and continuing education to maintain or support your professional designations
* Community Involvement perks, including 8 hours paid volunteer time per quarter, charitable contributions matched by TPG, and an all\\-company holiday volunteer day

**Commitment To Diversity**

TPG promotes a culture of inclusion and is committed to growing the diversity of our workforce. This is a place where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their goals and meet the needs of our clients and the communities we serve. Embracing and encouraging a diverse range of perspectives makes us stronger, smarter, and more effective. The sum of our individual differences drives our culture, reputation, and achievements.

  


**Apply Today**

Join our team and help us maximize the potential of Salesforce to drive efficiency and innovation! Complete the application using your resume \\- a cover letter is not required, but we'd love to learn why you're interested in the opportunity to join us.

  


*The Partners Group provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*

*This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.*

  


*We use E\\-Verify to confirm the identity and employment eligibility of all new hires.*

title: Associate Developer (EDI) - IS Connected and Intelligent Solutions
description:
Company Description  
  
“We’re not in the shipping business; we’re in the information business” \\-Peter Rose, Expeditors Founder

Global supply chain management is what we do, but at the heart of Expeditors you will find professionalism, leadership, and a friendly environment, all of which foster an innovative, customer service\\-based approach to logistics.

* 18,000 trained professionals
* 350\\+ locations worldwide across 60\\+ countries
* Fortune 500
* Globally unified systems

Job Description  
  
Expeditors exchanges over 35 million Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) messages each month with our customers, service providers, and government agencies. EDI provides tremendous business value. The Connected Customer Developer creates and maintains EDI based business translations that exchange electronic messages with internal and external systems. You will be part of a team that is responsible for analyzing, testing, installing, and supporting this business critical information.

*This position is on\\-site and will reside in the greater Seattle, WA. at one of the following locations depending on availability. Candidates must be local or willing to relocate. Relocation assistance is not offered for this position.*

* *Downtown Seattle*
* *Federal Way*
* *Lynnwood*
* *Bellevue (Factoria)*

Qualifications  
  
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

* Solid knowledge in at least one high\\-level language e.g. C\\+\\+/C, Java, PHP or Python
* Understanding of database structures and data relationships
* Ability to design creative solutions to meet client's business and technical needs
* Customer service\\-oriented attitude and top\\-notch time management
* Programming experience (4\\-year degree or a minimum of 1 year of professional experience)

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS

* EDI knowledge (ANSI, EDIFACT, \\& RosettaNet standards)
* Understanding of the transportation/logistics industry
* Experience with SQL
* WebMethods development experience is a strong plus

*Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not transfer or sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (such as an H\\-1B visa) for this opportunity.* 

  
  
Additional Information  
  
Expected base salary: $80,000 to $120,000

Expeditors offers excellent benefits:

* Paid Vacation (first year prorated based off month of hire then eligible for 15 days)

This is a local position responsible for implementing and operationalizing corporate\\-level initiatives related to systems implementation, GIS, and systems project management. title: Field Sales Representative, West (Remote; Preferred Location: CA)
description:
Arcadia Publishing (Charleston, SC), the nation's leading publisher of local interest books, is seeking a motivated and experienced publishing sales professional to expand sales and strengthen relationships with independent bookstores and specialty retailers across multiple categories.

  


**Key Responsibilities**

* Grow frontlist and backlist sales across Arcadia's imprints, including Arcadia, Arcadia Children's Books, Applewood, The History Press, Belt Publishing, and Pelican.
* Expand business with existing accounts, reactivate dormant ones, and proactively acquire new accounts.
* Conduct in\\-person and virtual sales calls, leveraging market and account knowledge to recommend product selection and order quantities.
* Use **Salesforce** to manage accounts, track sales activity, and enter orders.
* Maximize backlist sales through inventory reviews and targeted sales strategies.
* Utilize **Edelweiss** to create custom Collections and Markups that support sales efforts.
* Represent Arcadia at trade shows and industry events.
* Collaborate with publicity, marketing, editorial, sales operations, and outbound sales teams to optimize account support and growth.
* Serve as a key internal communicator, providing insights that enhance customer awareness across all divisions of Arcadia.

  
  
* **5\\+ years** in book publishing sales or retail bookselling, with a strong understanding of the industry, market trends, and distribution channels.
* Proven ability to build and maintain business relationships, negotiate effectively, and exceed sales goals.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple accounts.
* Proficiency in **MS Office (especially Excel), Salesforce, and Edelweiss.**
* Seasonal travel for account visits and trade shows.
* Remote position requiring a dedicated workspace and reliable internet.

  


**Benefits:** Benefits include a competitive base salary with variable performance pay, health and 401k benefits, and paid time off. 

  


**About Arcadia Publishing**

As the nation's leading publisher of books of local history and local interest, Arcadia's mission is to connect people with their past, with their communities, and with one another. Arcadia is the home of the iconic sepia\\-jacketed *Images of America* series, featuring unique hyper\\-local histories of countless hometowns across all fifty states, as well as such series as *American Palate*, which focuses on local food, beer and wine, and *Haunted America*, which retells stories of famous hauntings, one American city and town at a time. Arcadia has an extraordinary catalog of more than 20,000 titles and publishes 500 new books of local interest and local history each year. Using its proprietary *Store Match* system, Arcadia can create a highly customized hyper\\-local book assortment for any storefront in the nation. 

  


**Arcadia Publishing is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.**

title: Quality Assurance Manager
description:
Balanced Diversity is conducting a search on behalf of our client, a leader in high\\-volume plastics manufacturing. Our client is committed to delivering high\\-quality products while ensuring compliance with industry standards and continuous process improvements. They are seeking a **Quality Assurance Manager** to oversee quality operations, drive compliance, and lead continuous improvement initiatives.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Quality Management System Development \\& Compliance:**

* 
Develop, implement, and maintain quality assurance policies, procedures, and systems.

* 
Ensure compliance with industry standards (e.g., ISO 9001 \\& ISO 13485\\) and customer requirements.


**Operational Oversight:**

* 
Lead daily quality control operations and manage the QA team to enforce quality standards throughout production.

* 
Oversee inspection, testing, and validation processes for raw materials, in\\-process components, and finished products.


**Continuous Improvement \\& Problem Solving:**

* 
Initiate and drive continuous improvement projects focused on defect reduction and process optimization.

* 
Conduct root cause analysis for quality issues and implement corrective and preventive actions.


**Cross\\-Functional Collaboration:**

* 
Partner with production, engineering, supply chain, and customer service teams to resolve quality concerns and implement best practices.

* 
Participate in process validations to ensure manufacturability and product quality.


**Documentation \\& Reporting:**

* 
Maintain comprehensive quality documentation, including quality manuals, SOPs, inspection reports, and audit findings.

* 
Manage and report quality performance metrics to leadership.


**Training \\& Supplier/Customer Relations:**

* 
Develop and deliver training programs on quality assurance processes, standards, and best practices.

* 
Collaborate with suppliers to ensure incoming materials meet quality standards.

* 
Interface with customers and regulatory bodies regarding quality concerns, audit responses, and compliance matters.


**Qualifications \\& Skills:**

* 
**1–3 years** of quality assurance experience in the plastics industry or a high\\-volume manufacturing environment.

* 
**Bachelor’s degree** in Engineering or a related field.

* 
Strong leadership skills with the ability to manage and develop a quality team.

* 
Proficiency in data analysis and statistical techniques (e.g., Minitab, Excel, MATLAB).

* 
Experience with ISO 9001 and/or ISO 13485 audits.

* 
Knowledge of **GD\\&T** principles.


**Preferred Qualifications:**

* 
Certified Quality Engineer (CQE) or Six Sigma Green Belt (SSGB).

* 
Experience with **lean manufacturing principles**.


**Why Join Our Client?**

* 
Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.

* 
Career growth and professional development opportunities.

* 
A collaborative environment where innovation and quality drive success.


**Equal Opportunity Employer Statement:**  
Balanced Diversity and our client are equal opportunity employers. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

title: Senior Project Manager - Network Engineering
description:
**Title: Senior Technical Project Manager Network Engineering  
 Location: Remote / Multiple Time Zones**   
  
 **Ekman Associates, Inc. is a Southern California based company focused on the following services: Management Consulting, Professional Staffing Solutions, Executive Recruiting and Managed Services.**   
  
 **Summary**  : We are seeking a Sr. Technical Project Manager (PM) in Network Engineering. The expectation of this role is to combine technical expertise (network / infrastructure) with project management skills to oversee and deliver network infrastructure projects, ensuring successful implementation and alignment with business needs. This role requires someone who is able to manage multiple complex programs / projects and drive results.   
  
 **Key Skill Set:** * Program / Project Management (PMP or CSM Preferred)
* Network Infrastructure Expertise (Mandatory)
* Experience managing projects focused on rearchitecting corporate networks.

  
 **Responsibilities**  : * The right candidate will possess strong network / infrastructure program management skills, will have demonstrated experience overseeing large projects domestic and international.
* Must be able to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment and not be hindered by ambiguity or multiple priorities. This means you are not only able to develop and drive high\\-level strategic initiatives, but can also roll up your sleeves, dig in and get the job done.
* Program Manager complex, multi\\-disciplinary Network engineering projects using your engineering expertise. Plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders.
* An ability to take large, complex projects and break them down into manageable pieces, then deliver them in a successful and timely manner is expected.
* Oversee high\\-impact projects, anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, make trade\\-offs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints.
* Ability to take large multinational, complex projects and break them down into manageable pieces, then deliver them in a successful and timely manner is expected.
* Program Manager complex, multi\\-disciplinary Network engineering projects using your engineering expertise. Plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders.
* Serve as the single point of contact for assigned engineering teams as program manager, project manager, or scrum master depending on assignments
* Lead and manage multiple programs and projects and activities of varying methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, Kanban), types, and sizes, ensuring objectives and project deliverables are accomplished according to plan
* Deliver timely, effective, easily understandable, concise project deliverables including detailed project work plans, presentations, budget reviews, cross\\-project dependencies, risks analyses and mitigation, strategies, stakeholder coordination and status communication.
* Communicate across audiences, effectively understanding and utilizing escalation paths, and updating stakeholders.
* Accountable for driving delivery of projects from start to finish.

 **Qualifications:** * BA/BS in business, computer science preferred or other technical field or appropriate work experience 10\\+ years of applicable experience in a technology environment, preferably for a large company.
* Demonstrated success in the delivery of multiple projects.
* PMP or CSM Certifications.
* This position requires strong communication, project management, and Agile skills.
* Experience managing corporate network redesigns from start to finish.
* 10\\+ years' experience leading complex engineering programs and projects.
* Excellent organization and communication skills, as well as strong and consistent attention to detail.
* Understanding of software and infrastructure engineering technologies (data center, compute, storage, network, database, cloud, devops, infrastructure as code, front/back\\-end development, security, etc.)
* Technical depth in corporate networks (backbone, ISP, bandwidth, etc.), architecting, WAN/LAN, network reliability, etc.
* Ability to effectively summarize status and communicate with senior leadership.
* Adaptable performer who can lead effectively with a lot of ambiguity.
* Ability to manage multiple programs and projects independently.
* Results\\-oriented with initiative to work until job is complete
* Exceptional technical, analytical, organizational, and research skills
* Detailed oriented and strong communicator.
* Results\\-oriented, high energy, self\\-motivated.

 **Qualified Candidates Only**  : If you wish to learn more about this opportunity and additional qualifications/responsibilities, please submit your resume. To learn more about Ekman Associates, Inc. please visit our website at www.ekmanassociates.com

title: Maintenance & Operations (M&O) Project Manager
description:
https://kkcsinc.com/

Program Management \\| Construction Management 

Kal Krishnan Consulting Services, Inc. (KKCS), a California Corporation, is a full\\-service construction management and program management organization. The firm has grown steadily in size and capability since its founding in 1987, and today employs more than 95 professionals in our regional offices. KKCS has attracted to its staff a full complement of highly experienced, talented, and dedicated professionals who bring a collaborative, integrated team approach to our clients’ projects.

 

KKCS experience includes work on rail, airports, ports, freeways, schools, universities, facilities, water, wastewater, bridges, and roadways. Our client list includes federal agencies, state agencies, regional agencies, and private clients. KKCS has broad experience and expertise in engineering design, project management, and project controls services. 

 

The KKCS culture is rooted in the ideals of integrity, safety, diversity, and ethical business practices, which is a commitment shared by all KKCS employees throughout our offices and project sites around the country. We have a positive impact on the communities we serve by not only improving infrastructure, but also providing service at a relatively low cost to the taxpayer. This allows for more money to be available to the agencies we serve, that inevitably will be reinvested in the community. At KKCS, we value the individual employee and the importance of their contributions toward quality improvement.

  


**M\\&O \\- Project Manager– School facility** 

**COMPENSATION \\& BENEFITS**

* Salary Range: $119,800 \\- $124,800 annually
* Company\\-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees
* 401k retirement plan with company matching contribution
* Paid holidays
* Paid time off
* Company\\-paid life and accidental death \\& dismemberment (AD\\&D) benefits
* Company\\-paid long\\-term (LTD) insurance
* Annual tuition assistance allowance for employees
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

  


**POSITION DESCRIPTION SUMMARY**

KKCS is seeking an experienced **Maintenance \\& Operations (M\\&O) Project Manager** to oversee, manage, and coordinate all aspects of pre\\-construction, bid and award, construction, and project close\\-out phases for assigned educational facility projects. The position is full\\-time, contract, W2, and onsite in Los Angeles, CA. 

**Responsibilities:*** Manage, oversee, and coordinate pre\\-construction, bidding, construction, and close\\-out phases of projects.
* Review and comment on pre\\-construction documents.
* Plan, organize, and prepare detailed progress/status reports for upper management.
* Coordinate compliance with public agencies during project phases.
* Manage project budgets and schedules, ensuring qualitative standards are met.
* Oversee contractors' daily activities, schedules, submittals, and respond to RFCs.
* Review contractor substitution submittals to ensure compliance with specifications and District requirements.
* Negotiate contractor change order proposals to achieve fair and reasonable pricing.
* Monitor and manage payments for contractors, architects, engineers, and related entities.
* Administer Professional Service Agreements between architects and the District.
* Coordinate delivery of fixtures, furniture, and equipment by the District.
* Monitor and manage project close\\-out, ensuring certification compliance with the Division of State Architect (DSA) and financial close\\-out.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Requirements:  
 Experience:*** Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, or Construction Management from an accredited institution.
* A minimum of eight (8\\) years of full\\-time professional experience in Project/Construction Management for commercial and/or public/educational facility construction, managing complex projects with construction values of $2M or greater.

**Preferred Qualifications:*** Experience utilizing Building Information Modeling (BIM).
* Experience with Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) certified projects or the Collaborative for High Performing Schools (CHPS).
* Familiarity with the Division of State Architect (DSA) construction/design/certification process.

**How to Apply:**If you meet the qualifications and are interested in joining our team, please fill out the application online \\& submit your resume.

  


**KKCS is an equal\\-opportunity employer encouraging individuals with disabilities and veterans to apply**

This role involves creating intuitive, responsive, and powerful interfaces that enable users to interact seamlessly with our AI systems. The ideal candidate will have expertise in modern frontend development, UI/UX design principles, and experience with real\\-time web applications and AI\\-powered interfaces.

*

*

Commensurate with experience

title: Sr. Purchasing Manager
description:
**Join Cytek and Lead the Future of Purchasing \\& Planning!**

Are you a strategic thinker with a passion for supply chain excellence? Do you thrive in a fast\\-paced environment where you can make a real impact? Cytek is looking for a **Sr. Purchasing Manager** to drive our procurement and planning operations to the next level.

**About the Role:**As the **Sr. Purchasing Manager**, you'll oversee critical purchasing and S\\&OP planning functions, ensuring smooth production and service operations across all product lines. You’ll collaborate closely with cross\\-functional teams, optimize supply chain efficiencies, and establish strong supplier partnerships to support our mission. Your leadership will be key in ensuring we meet our goals for quality, cost, and delivery.

**What You’ll Do:*** 
**Own the Procurement Process** – Manage the purchasing of essential components for production, R\\&D, and services across multiple value streams.

* 
**Streamline Supply Chain Operations** – Lead material procurement activities, supplier scheduling, and order management while mitigating risks and handling escalations.

* 
**Drive S\\&OP Planning** – Develop and execute sales \\& operations planning for instruments, subassemblies, and make parts to meet demand.

* 
**Collaborate for Success** – Work closely with Manufacturing, Shipping/Receiving, Facilities, and Quality teams to align priorities and track performance.

* 
**Supplier \\& Contract Management** – Partner with R\\&D, NPI Engineering, and Supplier Quality teams to ensure top\\-tier supplier selection and component quality.

* 
**Optimize for Efficiency** – Implement cost\\-reduction initiatives, continuous improvement programs, and best practices in supplier management.

* 
**Lead \\& Develop a High\\-Performing Team** – Manage and mentor purchasing and planning team members, establish SOPs, and drive KPI improvements.


**What You’ll Bring:*** 
**Education** – Bachelor’s degree required (MBA preferred).

* 
**Experience** – 7\\-10 years in professional purchasing, including 2\\-5 years in management. Bio\\-tech experience is a plus.

* 
**Technical Proficiency** – Strong skills in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and ERP/MRP systems like SAP or NetSuite. Experience with Source\\-to\\-Pay suites (Coupa, Zycus) is a bonus.

* 
**Industry Knowledge** – Familiarity with medical device components, reagents, and supplier pricing models.

* 
**Negotiation \\& Communication Skills** – Ability to build strong relationships, negotiate effectively, and communicate clearly.

* 
**Certifications** – ASCM CPIM or ISM CPSM certifications are highly desirable.

* 
**Continuous Improvement Mindset** – Demonstrated success in leading Lean initiatives and driving cost reductions.


**What to Expect:*** 
Travel as needed to visit suppliers.

* 
Ability to lift up to 25lbs and stand for extended periods when required.


At **Cytek**, we’re committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where all voices are heard. We offer a collaborative, innovation\\-driven environment where your contributions truly make a difference.

**Ready to take your career to the next level? Apply now and be part of a team shaping the future of biotechnology!**

title: Property Operations Corporate Manager
description:
Description:**Job Title:** Property Operations Corporate Manager 

**Department:** Property Operations

**Reports** **To:** Vice President of Property Operations

**FLSA Status:** Exempt

**Salary:** $90,000 \\- $100,000 

**Generous Benefits Package includes:**

* Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance \\& Employee Assistant Program \\~ fully covered for Employee
* Optional Life, Long Term Disability, Critical Illness, Identity Theft Protection and Accident Insurance
* Generous paid time off, including16 paid holidays which includes the week between Christmas and New Years
* 2 Floating Holidays (16 hours)
* 401K Retirement Plan \\~ Employer match up to 6% \\~ after 6 months service.

**SUMMARY**

 The Property Operations Corporate Manager has a key role in managing the overall operational efficiencies of the Property Operations team. This role leads various departmental decisions attributed to overall efficiency, systems and software organization, communication, risk management, industry best practices and strategic support to implement and maintain operational excellence across all areas of the Property Operations department. Reporting to the VPPO, the Property Operations Corporate Manager guides department leadership staff through analyzing data while providing solutions to any identified gaps. This role also builds upon our existing skillsets to build upon our success in maximizing effort and impact. The Property Operations Corporate Manager will develop and implement adaptive strategies to move the department forward, by keeping up with future growth, and technological advancements to strengthen the team 

  


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

  
**Operational Efficiency: Streamlining daily department operations, ensuring efficiency and organization.**

* Maintains department calendar of events. Proactively prompts team of upcoming events
* Maintains and manages accurate department records and tracking systems in SharePoint
* Creates and maintains property information workbooks for each community.
* Manages the collection and storage of departmental and property specific lease\\-up/transition docs (i.e. – emergency plans, warranty workbook, etc.)
* Onboarding support (in collaboration with the Property Operations Training Manager, helps with meeting coordination, property information documents, etc.)
* Manages all department documents, including the creation of new documents on SharePoint
* Recommend and create policy/procedure changes, as applicable
* Identify and implement automated systems for better efficiency. Assess systems to ensure efficiency and effectiveness.
* Manage on\\-call after hours vendor communications
* Oversee ordering of maintenance staff uniforms and name badges for new hires

**Financial Administration: Creates, analyzes and tracks progress of various department metrics. Disseminates to VPPO.** 

* Analyzes department data for forecasting and immediate or strategic action.
* Assists VPPO with budget preparation and process, managing to timelines, etc.
* Reviews portfolio benchmarks identifying strengths and opportunities
* Escalates and effectively communicates risk to DPO and VPPO
* Review management plans, agreements, vendor contracts, etc. for compliance with company and department standards

**Risk Management: Facilitates escalation of identified risk**

* Resident litigation – tracks and monitors legal action; follow up with team to ensure timely action, where applicable
* Insurance claim management – manages tracking logs and assists in financial management and impacts for LOI
* Establishes and reviews contracts for vendors. Ensures compliance with company standards and liability. Collaboratively works with accounting to establish new vendors.
* In collaboration with Director of Property Operations and Training Manager, monitors new laws and regulation changes – creates action plan, documents, implementation timelines and execution, in adherence with applicable changes Audits Preventative maintenance reporting ensuring building physical condition compliance
* Manage and update our lease templates, addendums and screening processes of affordable housing, in collaboration with DPO and in accordance with any legal or other requirements. Engage with screening company to implement changes.
* Provide guidance on Section 504 concerns, escalating risk to appropriate personnel

**Systems Specialist: Utilize technology as a resource, advancing technology adoption** 

* Identify and recommend Yardi best practices reporting for Prop Ops team
* Assist with invoice processing in Yardi
* Actively extract and analyze data in Yardi to ensure accuracy and identify deficiencies
* Audit various reports and assist with property set\\-up oversight with new construction

**Communication: Maintains effective and efficient communication throughout organization**

* Act as liaison between VPPO and cross\\-departments on various topics
* Engage with applicants and residents to address concerns and/or escalate to appropriate personnel for resolve. Follow\\-through to ensure resolution and good customer service.
* Ensure visibility, recognition and inclusive communication through management of ATM Prop Ops page
* Visually demonstrate department goals and “wins” on ATM Prop Ops page
* Identify and implement ways to enhance employee recognition
* Maintain property waitlist availability on each community webpage (informing applicants of waitlist status)
* Create and submit weekly department updates to MHC Newsletter
* Draft memo’s and announcements through various team communication channels (email, Teams, ATM, etc)
* Oversight and assistance in market surveys, website establishment and software implementation in relation to lease\\-up efforts
* Assist transitions of properties, in/out of the portfolio. Facilitate and lead communication with all applicable parties; follows\\-through on deliverables
* Provide prompt and professional communication with external partners and others, as directed by the VPPO

  


**Strategic \\& Executive\\-Level Support:**

* Develop executive summaries and reports for VPPO, analyzing operational trends and key performance indicators (KPIs) for department and process improvement
* Act as a liaison between property operations and executive leadership, providing insights and recommendations on process improvements.

**Leadership \\& Decision Support:**

* Lead special projects that require collaboration between property management, compliance, and asset management to enhance operational efficiency.
* Facilitate alignment between training initiatives and operational needs by identifying gaps in employee knowledge and procedural adherence.
* Provide guidance and decision\\-support for operational challenges by analyzing data, identifying trends, and offering solutions to VPPO.
* Assess the impact of operational decisions on long\\-term business goals and recommend adjustments as needed.
* Lead various department initiatives, conduct meetings, moratoriums and memorialize actions to lead implementation

Requirements:**QUALIFICATIONS**

  


**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE**

* Associates or B.A. (or equivalent degree) or 2 \\- 4 years of relevant industry experience
* Advanced efficiency in Microsoft Office including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Microsoft docs.
* Advanced efficiency in Yardi Voyager software system

**REQUIRED SKILLS**

* **Operational Leadership and Project Management:** Ability to oversee daily operations, lead department initiatives, and manage cross\\-departmental projects to improve efficiency.
* **Data Analysis and Financial Acumen:** Skilled in analyzing department metrics, forecasting, and assisting with budget preparation to support strategic decision\\-making. Drills down on details to identify core issues and actively creates plans for resolve.
* **Strong Communication and Collaboration:** Proven ability to act as a liaison between leadership and cross\\-department teams, ensuring effective, timely communication and coordination.
* **Compliance and Risk Management Expertise:** Knowledge of affordable housing regulatory requirements, knowledge of CA Tenant Landlord law requirements, contract review, and risk mitigation strategies, including Section 504 compliance and legal action monitoring.
* **Proficiency in Systems and Document Management:** Experience creating and managing records in SharePoint, overseeing website updates, and implementing automated systems for improved operational workflows.

**LANGUAGE ABILITY**

Ability to read, interpret and analyze documents and/or data such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals to provide informative recommended next steps. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of the organization.

**WORK ENVIORNEMNT** 

The work environment characteristics and physical demands described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, reach with hands and arms, and talk or hear.
* The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.
* Exposure to exterior elements on occasion.
* May require lifting up to 25 pounds.

**The above job description is not intended to be an all\\-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions and perform related duties, as assigned by their** **supervisor.**

title: Free Nursing Assistant Class - Avamere at Ridgemont
description:
***Interested in becoming a Certified Nursing Assistant? Let us help!***

***We are offering a FREE class to become a Nursing Assistant*** 

**Location:** Avamere at Ridgemont \\- 2051 Pottery Ave. Port Orchard, WA 98366 \\- (360\\) 876\\-4461

***Submit your application and attend one of our Info Sessions*** 

***Bring 2 pieces of ID and your Resume!***

**Apply at Teamavamere.com** 

* The theory portion will be held **online** via Zoom, Monday through Thursday from 8:30AM\\-1:20PM \\- must have working camera
* **Clinical hours will be completed at the our facility in Port Orchard, WA**
* Facility pays testing fees for successful graduates
* All applicants must pass a background check
* **Guaranteed employment upon successful completion of the course!**

**This is a great start to become a Nursing Assistant in the State of Washington and is also a wonderful step to becoming a licensed nurse. Avamere offers tuition reimbursement for Nursing School after one year of full\\-time employment.**

**You Will Learn To:**

* Check each resident routinely to ensure that his/her personal care needs are being met in accordance with his/her wishes.
* Review care plans daily to determine if changes in the resident’s daily care routine have been made on the care plan.
* Inform the Nurse Supervisor of any changes in the resident’s condition so that appropriate information can be entered on the resident’s care plan.
* Assist resident’s with daily needs, including preparation for activity and social programs, and transporting residents to/from appointments.
* Create and uphold an atmosphere of warmth, patience, enthusiasm, and a calm and cheerful environment.
* Ensure that resident’s rooms are ready for receiving and make residents comfortable.
* Participate in facility surveys by authorized government agencies

**Requirements:**

* Must be at least 18 years of age.
* Must possess a minimum of a 10th grade education.
* Maintain confidentiality of all resident care information in accordance with HIPAA guidelines.
* Effectively communicate necessary resident information to Charge Nurses, Director of Nursing and/or Administrator.
* Must speak, read, and write English fluently

**At Avamere, we believe in taking care of our employees. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes:**

* Health Insurance: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans. Low individual and family deductible.
* 401 (k) Plan: After 90 days of employment, with matching program.
* Paid Time Off (PTO): Accrue up to 4 weeks PTO per year, 6 holidays and accrued sick leave.
* EAP Canopy with unlimited telehealth mental health visits.
* Continuing Education and Higher Education Reimbursement.
* Generous employee referral bonus program.
* Flexible Spending Accounts \\& CERA: Medical FSA, Dependent Care FSA and CERA (Commuter Expense Reimbursement Account).
* Professional Development: Opportunities for growth and development within the company.
* Voluntary Benefits: Life insurance, disability coverage, supplemental hospital, accident and critical illness coverage, Legal Services, Pet Insurance, discount programs and more.

*Avamere is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E\\-Verify.”*
